alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Douglas (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 06 at 12:16AM CST until March 06 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM CST FOR COLES...EDGAR...NORTHERN CLARK...SOUTHERN VERMILION... SOUTHEASTERN CHAMPAIGN AND DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 1215 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hindsboro, or 12 miles southeast of Tuscola, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Broadcast media. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Oakland, Newman, Brocton, Hume, Redmon, Paris and Chrisman. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 181 and 216. Interstate 70 between mile markers 136 and 154. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. This storm is producing widespread wind damage across southern Douglas and norther Coles counties. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
